id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation. Useful when multiple receivers are configured on a single device.

*See also: [Remote Receiver](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.docs:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin to receive the remote signal on.

*See also: [Remote Receiver](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#configuration-variables)*

dump.docs:
**list**: Decode and dump these remote codes in the logs (at log.level=DEBUG). Set to `all` to dump all available codecs:
  * **abbwelcome**: Decode and dump ABB-Welcome codes. Messages are sent via copper wires. See [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-abbwelcome) for more details.
  
  * **aeha**: Decode and dump AEHA infrared codes.
  
  * **byronsx**: Decode and dump Byron SX doorbell RF codes.
  
  * **canalsat**: Decode and dump CanalSat infrared codes.
  
  * **canalsatld**: Decode and dump CanalSatLD infrared codes.
  
  * **coolix**: Decode and dump Coolix infrared codes.
  
  * **dish**: Decode and dump Dish infrared codes.
  
  * **dooya**: Decode and dump Dooya RF codes.
  
  * **drayton**: Decode and dump Drayton Digistat RF codes.
  
  * **jvc**: Decode and dump JVC infrared codes.
  
  * **keeloq**: Decode and dump KeeLoq RF codes.
  
  * **haier**: Decode and dump Haier infrared codes.
  
  * **lg**: Decode and dump LG infrared codes.
  
  * **magiquest**: Decode and dump MagiQuest wand infrared codes.
  
  * **midea**: Decode and dump Midea infrared codes.
  
  * **nec**: Decode and dump NEC infrared codes.
  
  * **nexa**: Decode and dump Nexa (RF) codes.
  
  * **panasonic**: Decode and dump Panasonic infrared codes.
  
  * **pioneer**: Decode and dump Pioneer infrared codes.
  
  * **pronto**: Print remote code in Pronto form. Useful for using arbitrary protocols.
  
  * **raw**: Print all remote codes in their raw form. Also useful for using arbitrary protocols.
  
  * **rc5**: Decode and dump RC5 IR codes.
  
  * **rc6**: Decode and dump RC6 IR codes.
  
  * **rc_switch**: Decode and dump RCSwitch RF codes.
  
  * **roomba**: Decode and dump Roomba infrared codes.
  
  * **samsung**: Decode and dump Samsung infrared codes.
  
  * **samsung36**: Decode and dump Samsung36 infrared codes.
  
  * **sony**: Decode and dump Sony infrared codes.
  
  * **toshiba_ac**: Decode and dump Toshiba AC infrared codes.
  
  * **mirage**: Decode and dump Mirage infrared codes.
  
  * **toto**: Decode and dump Toto infrared codes.
  
  

*See also: [Remote Receiver](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#configuration-variables)*

tolerance.docs:
**int, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time) or mapping**: The percentage or time that the remote signal lengths can deviate in the decoding process.  Defaults to `25%`.
  * **type** (**Required**, enum): Set the type of the tolerance. Can be `percentage` or `time`.
  
  * **value** (**Required**, int or [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): The percentage or time value. Allowed values are in range `0` to `100%` or `0` to `4294967295us`.
  
  

*See also: [Remote Receiver](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#configuration-variables)*

buffer_size.docs:
**int**: The size of the internal buffer for storing the remote codes. Defaults to `10kB` on the ESP32 and `1kB` on the ESP8266.

*See also: [Remote Receiver](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#configuration-variables)*

filter.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Filter any pulses that are shorter than this. Useful for removing glitches from noisy signals. Allowed values are in range `0` to `4294967295us`. Defaults to `50us`.

*See also: [Remote Receiver](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#configuration-variables)*

idle.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The amount of time that a signal should remain stable/unchanged for it to be considered complete. Allowed values are in range `0` to `4294967295us`. Defaults to `10ms`.

*See also: [Remote Receiver](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#configuration-variables)*

address.docs:
**int**: The 8-bit ID code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The 4-bit command to listen for. If omitted, will match on any command.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

byronsx.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Byron SX Doorbell RF remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The 8-bit ID code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (*Optional*, int): The 4-bit command to listen for. If omitted, will match on any command.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

canalsat.docs:
Trigger on a decoded CanalSat remote code with the given data.
  * **device** (**Required**, int): The device to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **address** (*Optional*, int): The address (or subdevice) to trigger on, see dumper output for more info. Defaults to `0`.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The command to listen for.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

canalsatld.docs:
Trigger on a decoded CanalSatLD remote code with the given data.
  * **device** (**Required**, int): The device to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **address** (*Optional*, int): The address (or subdevice) to trigger on, see dumper output for more info. Defaults to `0`.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The command to listen for.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

first.docs:
**uint32_t**: The first 24-bit Coolix code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

second.docs:
**uint32_t**: The second 24-bit Coolix code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info. If not set, trigger on on only single non-strict packet, specified by the `first` parameter.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

coolix.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Coolix remote code with the given data. It is possible to directly specify a 24-bit code, it will be checked for a match to at least one of the two received packets. The main configuration scheme is below.
  * **first** (**Required**, uint32_t): The first 24-bit Coolix code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **second** (*Optional*, uint32_t): The second 24-bit Coolix code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info. If not set, trigger on on only single non-strict packet, specified by the `first` parameter.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The number of the receiver to target, between 1 and 16 inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The Dish command to listen for, between 0 and 63 inclusive.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

dish.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Dish Network remote code with the given data. Beware that Dish remotes use a different carrier frequency (57.6kHz) that many receiver hardware don’t decode.
  * **address** (*Optional*, int): The number of the receiver to target, between 1 and 16 inclusive. Defaults to `1`.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The Dish command to listen for, between 0 and 63 inclusive.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

id.docs:
**int**: The 24-bit ID code to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

channel.docs:
**int**: The 8-bit channel to listen for.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

button.docs:
**int**: The 4-bit button to listen for.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

check.docs:
**int**: The 4-bit check to listen for. Includes an indication that a button is being held down.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

dooya.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Dooya RF remote code with the given data.
  * **id** (**Required**, int): The 24-bit ID code to trigger on.
  
  * **channel** (**Required**, int): The 8-bit channel to listen for.
  
  * **button** (**Required**, int): The 4-bit button to listen for.
  
  * **check** (**Required**, int): The 4-bit check to listen for. Includes an indication that a button is being held down.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**int**: The JVC code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

jvc.docs:
Trigger on a decoded JVC remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The JVC code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**int**: The LG code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

nbits.docs:
**int**: The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `28`.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

lg.docs:
Trigger on a decoded LG remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The LG code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **nbits** (*Optional*, int): The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `28`.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

wand_id.docs:
**int**: The MagiQuest wand ID to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

magnitude.docs:
**int**: The magnitude of swishes and swirls of the wand.  If omitted, will match on any activation of the wand.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

magiquest.docs:
Trigger on a decoded MagiQuest wand remote code with the given wand ID.
  * **wand_id** (**Required**, int): The MagiQuest wand ID to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **magnitude** (*Optional*, int): The magnitude of swishes and swirls of the wand.  If omitted, will match on any activation of the wand.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The 32-bit ID code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The 8-bit switch/command to listen for. If omitted, will match on any command/button.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

keeloq.docs:
Trigger on a decoded KeeLoq RF remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The 32-bit ID code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The 8-bit switch/command to listen for. If omitted, will match on any command/button.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The NEC command to listen for.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

nec.docs:
Trigger on a decoded NEC remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The NEC command to listen for.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_code_1.docs:
**int**: The remote control code to trigger on, see dumper output for more details.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

pioneer.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Pioneer remote code with the given data.
  * **rc_code_1** (**Required**, int): The remote control code to trigger on, see dumper output for more details.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**string**: The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

delta.docs:
**integer**: This parameter allows you to manually specify the allowed difference between what Pronto code is specified, and what IR signal has been sent by the remote control.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

pronto.docs:
Trigger on a Pronto remote code with the given code.
  * **data** (**Required**, string): The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.
  
  * **delta** (*Optional*, integer): This parameter allows you to manually specify the allowed difference between what Pronto code is specified, and what IR signal has been sent by the remote control.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**int**: The Roomba code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

roomba.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Roomba remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The Roomba code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**int**: The Sony code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

nbits.docs:
**int**: The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `12`.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

sony.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Sony remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The Sony code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **nbits** (*Optional*, int): The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `12`.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

code.docs:
**list**: The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

raw.docs:
Trigger on a raw remote code with the given code.
  * **code** (**Required**, list): The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The 16-bit ID code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

channel.docs:
**int**: The 7-bit switch/channel to listen for.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The 5-bit command to listen for.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

drayton.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Drayton Digistat RF remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The 16-bit ID code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **channel** (**Required**, int): The 7-bit switch/channel to listen for.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The 5-bit command to listen for.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The RC5 command to listen for.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc5.docs:
Trigger on a decoded RC5 remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The RC5 command to listen for.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The RC6 command to listen for.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc6.docs:
Trigger on a decoded RC6 remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The RC6 command to listen for.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

code.docs:
**string**: The remote code to listen for, copy this from the dumper output. To ignore a bit in the received data, use `x` at that place in the **code**.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

protocol.docs:
The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_switch_raw.docs:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch raw remote code with the given data.
  * **code** (**Required**, string): The remote code to listen for, copy this from the dumper output. To ignore a bit in the received data, use `x` at that place in the **code**.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

group.docs:
**string**: The group, binary string.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

device.docs:
**string**: The device in the group, binary string.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

state.docs:
**boolean**: The on/off state to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

protocol.docs:
The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_switch_type_a.docs:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type A remote code with the given data.
  * **group** (**Required**, string): The group, binary string.
  
  * **device** (**Required**, string): The device in the group, binary string.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The address, int from 1 to 4.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

channel.docs:
**int**: The channel, int from 1 to 4.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

state.docs:
**boolean**: The on/off state to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

protocol.docs:
The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_switch_type_b.docs:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type B remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address, int from 1 to 4.
  
  * **channel** (**Required**, int): The channel, int from 1 to 4.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

family.docs:
**string**: The family. Range is `a` to `p`.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

group.docs:
**int**: The group. Range is 1 to 4.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

device.docs:
**int**: The device. Range is 1 to 4.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

state.docs:
**boolean**: The on/off state to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

protocol.docs:
The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_switch_type_c.docs:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type C remote code with the given data.
  * **family** (**Required**, string): The family. Range is `a` to `p`.
  
  * **group** (**Required**, int): The group. Range is 1 to 4.
  
  * **device** (**Required**, int): The device. Range is 1 to 4.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

group.docs:
**int**: The group. Range is 1 to 4.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

device.docs:
**int**: The device. Range is 1 to 3.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

state.docs:
**boolean**: The on/off state to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

protocol.docs:
The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_switch_type_d.docs:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type D remote code with the given data.
  * **group** (**Required**, int): The group. Range is 1 to 4.
  
  * **device** (**Required**, int): The device. Range is 1 to 3.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**int**: The data to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

nbits.docs:
**int**: The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `32`.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

samsung.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Samsung remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The data to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **nbits** (*Optional*, int): The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `32`.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

samsung36.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Samsung36 remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The command.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_code_1.docs:
**int**: The remote control code to trigger on, see dumper output for more details.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_code_2.docs:
**int**: The second part of the remote control code to trigger on, see dumper output for more details.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

toshiba_ac.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Toshiba AC remote code with the given data.
  * **rc_code_1** (**Required**, int): The remote control code to trigger on, see dumper output for more details.
  
  * **rc_code_2** (*Optional*, int): The second part of the remote control code to trigger on, see dumper output for more details.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

panasonic.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Panasonic remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The command.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

device.docs:
**int**: The Nexa device code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

group.docs:
**int**: The Nexa group code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

state.docs:
**int**: The Nexa state code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

channel.docs:
**int**: The Nexa channel code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

level.docs:
**int**: The Nexa level code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

nexa.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Nexa RF code with the given data.
  * **device** (**Required**, int): The Nexa device code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **group** (**Required**, int): The Nexa group code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, int): The Nexa state code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **channel** (**Required**, int): The Nexa channel code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **level** (**Required**, int): The Nexa level code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

code.docs:
**5-bytes list**: The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-midea) for more info. Usually you only need to copy first 5 bytes directly from the dumper output.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

midea.docs:
Trigger on a Midea remote code with the given code.
  * **code** (**Required**, 5-bytes list): The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-midea) for more info. Usually you only need to copy first 5 bytes directly from the dumper output.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

address.docs:
**int**: The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**3-35 bytes list**: The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-aeha) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

aeha.docs:
Trigger on a decoded AEHA remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **data** (**Required**, 3-35 bytes list): The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-aeha) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

code.docs:
**13-bytes list**: The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-haier) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

haier.docs:
Trigger on a Haier remote code with the given code.
  * **code** (**Required**, 13-bytes list): The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-haier) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

source_address.docs:
**int**: The source address to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

destination_address.docs:
**int**: The destination address to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

retransmission.docs:
**boolean**: `true` if the message was re-transmitted. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

three_byte_address.docs:
**boolean**: The length of the source and destination address. `false` means two bytes and `true` means three bytes. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

message_type.docs:
**int**: The message type to trigger on.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

message_id.docs:
**int**: The random message ID to trigger on, see dumper output for more info. Defaults to any ID.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

data.docs:
**0-7 bytes list**: The code to listen for. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output. Defaults to `[]`

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

abbwelcome.docs:
Trigger on a decoded ABB-Welcome code with the given data, see the [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-abbwelcome) for more info.
  * **source_address** (**Required**, int): The source address to trigger on.
  
  * **destination_address** (**Required**, int): The destination address to trigger on.
  
  * **three_byte_address** (*Optional*, boolean): The length of the source and destination address. `false` means two bytes and `true` means three bytes. Defaults to `false`.
  
  * **retransmission** (*Optional*, boolean): `true` if the message was re-transmitted. Defaults to `false`.
  
  * **message_type** (**Required**, int): The message type to trigger on.
  
  * **message_id** (*Optional*, int): The random message ID to trigger on, see dumper output for more info. Defaults to any ID.
  
  * **data** (*Optional*, 0-7 bytes list): The code to listen for. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output. Defaults to `[]`
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

code.docs:
**14-bytes list**: The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-mirage) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

mirage.docs:
Trigger on a Mirage remote code with the given code.
  * **code** (**Required**, 14-bytes list): The code to listen for, see [transmitter description](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-mirage) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_code_1.docs:
**int**: The first 4-bit Toto code (usually a command parameter) to trigger on. Range is 0 to 0xF.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

rc_code_2.docs:
**int**: The second 4-bit Toto code (usually a command parameter) to trigger on. Range is 0 to 0xF.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

command.docs:
**int**: The 1-byte Toto command code to trigger on. Range is 0 to 0xFF.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

toto.docs:
Trigger on a decoded Toto remote code with the given data.
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The 1-byte Toto command code to trigger on. Range is 0 to 0xFF.
  
  * **rc_code_1** (*Optional*, int): The first 4-bit Toto code (usually a command parameter) to trigger on. Range is 0 to 0xF.
  
  * **rc_code_2** (*Optional*, int): The second 4-bit Toto code (usually a command parameter) to trigger on. Range is 0 to 0xF.
  
  

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*

receiver_id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The remote receiver to receive the remote code with. Required if multiple receivers configured.

*See also: [remote_receiver Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id59)*
